alert.note: Alert for Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued June 05 at 5:06AM MDT until June 05 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE MULLEN FIRE BURN SCAR AREA IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM MDT THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall are possible over the Mullen Fire Burn Scar Area. * WHERE...A portion of south central Wyoming, including the following area, Snowy Range. * WHEN...From 11 AM MDT this morning until 9 PM MDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Thunderstorms, some with heavy rainfall, are expected to develop over and near the Snowy Range by late this morning, persisting through the afternoon into the early evening hours. Residents and those participating in outdoor activities near the Mullen Fire Burn Scar Area should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
